Name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Biography: Francis Scott Key Fitzgerald was an American writer, whose works illustrate the Jazz Age. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest American writers of the 20th century.

Name: Harper Lee
Biography: Nelle Harper Lee was an American novelist best known for her 1960 novel To Kill a Mockingbird. It won the Pulitzer Prize and has become a classic of modern American literature.

Name: George Orwell
Biography: Eric Arthur Blair, known by his pen name George Orwell, was an English novelist, essayist, journalist, and critic. His work is characterized by lucid prose, biting social criticism, opposition to totalitarianism, and outspoken support of democratic socialism.

Name: Jane Austen
Biography: Jane Austen was an English novelist known primarily for her six major novels, which interpret, critique and comment upon the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

Name: J.D. Salinger
Biography: Jerome David Salinger was an American writer best known for his novel The Catcher in the Rye. Salinger published several short stories in various magazines before his breakthrough with The Catcher in the Rye.
